title: Groupware Daouoffice
content:
Privacy Policy

DAOU Tech., INC. (hereinafter “the Company”) uses and provides the user’s personal information based on the user’s consent, and actively guarantees the user’s right (the right to control one’s own personal information). 
The Company complies with applicable laws, personal information protection regulations and guidelines of the Republic of Korea, which must be obeyed by information communication service providers.
Through this Policy, the Company regards personal information of the users as important and inform them of the purpose and method of the Company‘s using the personal information provided by the users and the measures taken by the Company for protection of those personal information. This Privacy Policy is applied to the Company’s service (hereinafter “Daouoffice”).

Article 1. Information to be collected and method of collection

  1. ①Personal information items to be collected
    1. 1.Personal information items to be collected by the Company are as follows.
      Essential information : Company name, Business license number, Visit route, Name, Position, Mobile number, Email address
    2. 2.Besides of information directly provided by the users, the Company may collect information in the course that the users use the service provided by the Company.
      IP Address, Cookie, Use time, history of service usage
    3. 3.Information collected when payment happens.
      1. a.Account Transfer : Bank name, Bank account number
    4. 4.Information collected when identification check is needed.
      Name, Birth date, Gender, Mobile phone number, i-Pin information, Encoded identification information (CI), Identification information of overlapped membership (DI)
  2. ②Method of collection
    1. a.Homepage, Written form, Fax, Telephone calling, E-mailing, Event application
    2. b.Provided by affiliates
    3. c.Tools for collection of created information
  3. ③The Company does not require personal information (such as race and ethnicity, ideology and creed, origin and place of origin, political orientation and criminal record, health status and sex life) that may violate basic human rights.

Article 2. Purpose of Collection and Use of Personal Information

  1. 1.Performance of contract and payment
    Provide content, charge for the paid service, send invoices
  2. 2.Client management
    1. -Identification for service use
    2. -Prevent unauthorized usage by fraudulent users
    3. -Check duplicate application
    4. -Confirm consent of legal representative when collecting personal information of children under 14 years of age
    5. -Preservation of records for dispute settlement
    6. -Handling complaints and delivering notices
  3. 3.Developing new services and marketing
    1. -Developing new services and providing customized services
    2. -Services provided on statistical characteristics and publishing advertisements
    3. -Validating services
    4. -Identifying access frequency
    5. -Providing statistics users’ usage
    6. -Event information and offering opportunities for participation
    7. -Providing advertising information
  4. 4.Use for customer consultation
    Use for consultation on product inquiries, etc.

Article 3. Sharing and providing personal information

The Company uses the user's personal information within the scope notified in Article 2 (Purpose of Collection and Use of Personal Information), and does not use it beyond the same scope or provide or share it to other persons or other institutions without prior consent from the users. Exceptions are made in the following cases.

The company provides personal information to third parties in the course of entrusting some parts of the affairs required for service provision.

  1. Consignment company : Daoudata
  2. Purpose of consignment work : processing of payment (via mobile phone, direct deposit without a bankbook, account transfer, credit card, other payment methods)
  3. The user's personal information is to be destroyed immediately when cancelling the use of daouoffice.

Article 4. Entrusting personal information

The Company provides personal information to third parties in the course of entrusting some parts of the affairs required for service provision. The Company also supervises and monitors the entrusted parties to abide by the relevant laws and regulations.

  1. 1.when the users consent to disclose in advance
  2. 2.when disclosure is required by the laws
  3. 3.when payment is needed for offering the service
  4. 4.When an individual is provided in an unidentifiable form for statistical preparation, academic research, or market research

Article 5. Period for retention and use of personal information

  1. ①In principle, the Company destructs personal information of users without delay when: the purpose of its collection and use has been achieved; the legal or management needs are satisfied; or users request: Provided that, if it is required to retain the information by relevant laws and 19 regulations, the Company will retain member information for certain period as designated by relevant laws and regulations. The information to be retained as required by relevant laws and regulations are as follows.
    1. 1.Retention category : Company name, Number of employee, Name, Business license number, Corporate registration number, Department, Position, Service use record, Access log, Cookie, Payment record
    2. 2.Applicable Law: The purpose of resolving complaints and disputes of users, prevention of fraudulent use, and cooperation in investigation with related agencies on illegal users.
    3. 3.Retention Period : 6 months
  2. ②If it is necessary to preserve the user's personal information for more than a certain period of time as prescribed by the relevant statutes, such as the Commercial Act or the Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc. In this case, the Company uses the information stored only for the purpose of storage and preserves it for the period of preservation according to the grounds specified in the preservation basis.
    1. 1.Records of contract or withdrawal of subscription
      1. a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc.
      2. b.Retention Period : 5 years
    2. 2.Records of payment and supplying goods
      1. a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc.
      2. b.Retention Period : 5 years
    3. 3.Records of electronic financial transactions
      1. a.Applicable Law : Electronic Financial Transactions Act
      2. b.Retention Period : 5 years
    4. 4.Records of consumer’s complaint and the settlement of dispute
      1. a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc
      2. b.Retention Period : 3 years
    5. 5.Record of identification
      1. a.Applicable Law : Act on Promotion of Information and Communication Network Utilization and Information Protection
      2. b.Retention Period : 6 months
    6. 6.Records of marks and advertisement
      1. a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc
      2. b.Retention Period : 6 months
    7. 7.Service visit records
      1. a.Applicable Law : Protection of Communications Secrets Act
      2. b.Retention Period : 3 months

Article 6. Procedure and method of destruction of personal information

In principle, the Company destructs the information immediately after the purposes of its collection and use have been achieved without delay.

  1. 1.Procedure of destruction
    1. a.Provided that, if any information is to be retained as required by relevant laws and regulations, the Company retain it for the period as required by those laws and regulations before destruction.
    2. b.In such event, the personal information which is stored and managed separately will never be used for other purposes.
  2. 2.Method of destruction
    1. a.The Company destructs hard copies of personal information by shredding with a pulverizer or incinerating it.
    2. b.Delete personal information stored in the form of electric file by using technological method making that information not restored.

Article 7. Cookies

  1. ①The Company may collect collective and impersonal information through 'cookies'. Cookies are very small text files to be sent to the browser of the users by the server used for operation of the websites of the Company and will be stored in hard-disks of the users' computer.
  2. ②The users have an option for cookie installation. So, they may either allow all cookies by setting option in web browser, make each cookie checked whenever it is saved, or refuses all cookies to be saved: Provided that, if the user rejects the installation of cookies, it may be difficult for that user to use the parts of services provided by the Company.

Article 8. Technical and managerial measures for protection of personal information

In order to prevent the loss, theft, leakage, alteration or damage of personal information of the users, the Company takes technical and managerial measures for securing safety as follows.

  1. 1.Technical measures
    1. a.Password encryption
    2. b.Secure transmitting by encryption of personal information
    3. c.Prevent from Hacking or viruses
    4. d.Backup and Vaccine software
    5. e.Install and operate access control devices and equipments
  2. 2.Managerial measures
    1. a.Limits access to personal information to a minimum number of people.
    2. b.Provide education and training for staffs treating personal information.
    3. c.Establish and execute internal management plan.

Article 9. Privacy Protection Officer and Responsible Department

  1. ①The Company designates the following Privacy Protection Officer in order to protect personal information of customers and deal with complaints from customers.
    Privacy Protection Officer Privacy Protection Officer
    Name : Jeong Jong Cheol Department : Biz Application Headquarters Name : Lee Ho Seop Department : Groupware Team
    Contact : 070-8707-1000 Position : Director Contact : 070-8707-1247 Position : Team Manager
    Email: privacy@daou.com Email : run@daou.co.kr
  2. ②If you need to report or consult about any other personal information breaches, please contact the following agencies.
    1. 1.KISA Report Center for Personal Information Breach (privacy.kisa.or.kr/ 118)
    2. 2.Cyber Crime Investigation, Supreme Prosecutors' Office (cyberid@spo.go.kr/ 02-3480-3571)
    3. 3.Cyber Terror Response Center, National Police Agency (www.ctrc.go.kr/ 182)

Article 10. 3rd party's sites and services

The website, product or service of the Company may include the links to the ones of a 3rd party and the privacy protection policy of the site of 3rd party may be different. Thus, it is required for the users to check additionally that policy of a 3rd party site linked to the site of the Company.

Article 11. Others

The Company may amend its Privacy Policy to reflect any legal or service changes. The Company shall notify such amendment 7 days earlier in advance

  • Notification Date: March 05, 2020
  • Enforcement Date : March 12, 2020
textContent:
Privacy Policy
				
				
					DAOU Tech., INC. (hereinafter “the Company”) uses and provides the user’s personal information based on the user’s consent, and actively guarantees the user’s right (the right to control one’s own personal information).  
					The Company complies with applicable laws, personal information protection regulations and guidelines of the Republic of Korea, which must be obeyed by information communication service providers.
					Through this Policy, the Company regards personal information of the users as important and inform them of the purpose and method of the Company‘s using the personal information provided by the users and the measures taken by the Company for protection of those personal information.
This Privacy Policy is applied to the Company’s service (hereinafter “Daouoffice”).

					
					Article 1. Information to be collected and method of collection
					
						①Personal information items to be collected
							
								1.Personal information items to be collected by the Company are as follows.
								Essential information : Company name, Business license number, Visit route, Name, Position, Mobile number, Email address
								2.Besides of information directly provided by the users, the Company may collect information in the course that the users use the service provided by the Company.
								IP Address, Cookie, Use time, history of service usage 
								3.Information collected when payment happens.
									
										a.Account Transfer : Bank name, Bank account number
									

								
								4.Information collected when identification check is needed.
								Name, Birth date, Gender, Mobile phone number, i-Pin information, Encoded identification information (CI), Identification information of overlapped membership (DI) 
							
						
						②Method of collection
							
								a.Homepage, Written form, Fax, Telephone calling, E-mailing, Event application
								b.Provided by affiliates
								c.Tools for collection of created information 
							
						
						③The Company does not require personal information (such as race and ethnicity, ideology and creed, origin and place of origin, political orientation and criminal record, health status and sex life) that may violate basic human rights.
					

					Article 2. Purpose of Collection and Use of Personal Information
					
						1.Performance of contract and payment
							Provide content, charge for the paid service, send invoices
						2.Client management
							
								-Identification for service use
								-Prevent unauthorized usage by fraudulent users
								-Check duplicate application
								-Confirm consent of legal representative when collecting personal information of children under 14 years of age
								-Preservation of records for dispute settlement
								-Handling complaints and delivering notices
							
						
						3.Developing new services and marketing
							
								-Developing new services and providing customized services
								-Services provided on statistical characteristics and publishing advertisements
								-Validating services
								-Identifying access frequency
								-Providing statistics users’ usage
								-Event information and offering opportunities for participation
								-Providing advertising information
							
						
						4.Use for customer consultation Use for consultation on product inquiries, etc.
					

					Article 3. Sharing and providing personal information
					The Company uses the user's personal information within the scope notified in Article 2 (Purpose of Collection and Use of Personal Information), and does not use it beyond the same scope or provide or share it to other persons or other institutions without prior consent from the users. Exceptions are made in the following cases.
					The company provides personal information to third parties in the course of entrusting some parts of the affairs required for service provision.
					
						Consignment company : Daoudata
						Purpose of consignment work : processing of payment (via mobile phone, direct deposit without a bankbook, account transfer, credit card, other payment methods)
						The user's personal information is to be destroyed immediately when cancelling the use of daouoffice.						
					

					Article 4. Entrusting personal information
					The Company provides personal information to third parties in the course of entrusting some parts of the affairs required for service provision. The Company also supervises and monitors the entrusted parties to abide by the relevant laws and regulations.
					
						1.when the users consent to disclose in advance
						2.when disclosure is required by the laws
						3.when payment is needed for offering the service
						4.When an individual is provided in an unidentifiable form for statistical preparation, academic research, or market research
					
				
				
					Article 5. Period for retention and use of personal information
					
						①In principle, the Company destructs personal information of users without delay when: the purpose of its collection and use has been achieved; the legal or management needs are satisfied; or users request: Provided that, if it is required to retain the information by relevant laws and 19 regulations, the Company will retain member information for certain period as designated by relevant laws and regulations. The information to be retained as required by relevant laws and regulations are as follows.
							
								1.Retention category : Company name, Number of employee, Name, Business license number, Corporate registration number, Department, Position, Service use record, Access log, Cookie, Payment record
								2.Applicable Law: The purpose of resolving complaints and disputes of users, prevention of fraudulent use, and cooperation in investigation with related agencies on illegal users. 
								3.Retention Period : 6 months
											
						②If it is necessary to preserve the user's personal information for more than a certain period of time as prescribed by the relevant statutes, such as the Commercial Act or the Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc. In this case, the Company uses the information stored only for the purpose of storage and preserves it for the period of preservation according to the grounds specified in the preservation basis.
							
								1.Records of contract or withdrawal of subscription
									
										a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc.
										b.Retention Period : 5 years
									
								
								2.Records of payment and supplying goods
									
										a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc.
										b.Retention Period : 5 years
									
								
								3.Records of electronic financial transactions
									
										a.Applicable Law : Electronic Financial Transactions Act
										b.Retention Period : 5 years
									
								
								4.Records of consumer’s complaint and the settlement of dispute
									
										a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc
										b.Retention Period : 3 years
									
								
								5.Record of identification
									
										a.Applicable Law : Act on Promotion of Information and Communication Network Utilization and Information Protection
										b.Retention Period : 6 months
									
												
								6.Records of marks and advertisement
									
										a.Applicable Law : Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc
										b.Retention Period : 6 months
									
								
								7.Service visit records
									
										a.Applicable Law : Protection of Communications Secrets Act
										b.Retention Period : 3 months
									
												
								
						
					


					Article 6. Procedure and method of destruction of personal information
					In principle, the Company destructs the information immediately after the purposes of its collection and use have been achieved without delay. 
					
						1.Procedure of destruction
							
								a.Provided that, if any information is to be retained as required by relevant laws and regulations, the Company retain it for the period as required by those laws and regulations before destruction.
								b.In such event, the personal information which is stored and managed separately will never be used for other purposes.
											
						
						2.Method of destruction
							
								a.The Company destructs hard copies of personal information by shredding with a pulverizer or incinerating it.
								b.Delete personal information stored in the form of electric file by using technological method making that information not restored.
											
						
					


					Article 7. Cookies
					
						①The Company may collect collective and impersonal information through 'cookies'. Cookies are very small text files to be sent to the browser of the users by the server used for operation of the websites of the Company and will be stored in hard-disks of the users' computer.
						②The users have an option for cookie installation. So, they may either allow all cookies by setting option in web browser, make each cookie checked whenever it is saved, or refuses all cookies to be saved: Provided that, if the user rejects the installation of cookies, it may be difficult for that user to use the parts of services provided by the Company.
					

					Article 8. Technical and managerial measures for protection of personal information 
					In order to prevent the loss, theft, leakage, alteration or damage of personal information of the users, the Company takes technical and managerial measures for securing safety as follows.

					
						1.Technical measures
							
								a.Password encryption
								b.Secure transmitting by encryption of personal information
								c.Prevent from Hacking or viruses
								d.Backup and Vaccine software
								e.Install and operate access control devices and equipments
											
						
						2.Managerial measures
							
								a.Limits access to personal information to a minimum number of people.
								b.Provide education and training for staffs treating personal information.
								c.Establish and execute internal management plan.
											
						
						



					Article 9. Privacy Protection Officer and Responsible Department
					
								
						①The Company designates the following Privacy Protection Officer in order to protect personal information of customers and deal with complaints from customers.
							
								
									
										Privacy Protection Officer	
										Privacy Protection Officer							
									
									
										Name : Jeong Jong Cheol	
										Department : Biz Application Headquarters
										Name : Lee Ho Seop	
										Department : Groupware Team						
									
									
										Contact  : 070-8707-1000
										Position : Director
										Contact  : 070-8707-1247 
										Position : Team Manager				
									
									
										Email: privacy@daou.com			
													
										Email : run@daou.co.kr			
													
									
								
							
						
						②If you need to report or consult about any other personal information breaches, please contact the following agencies.
							
								1.KISA Report Center for Personal Information Breach (privacy.kisa.or.kr/ 118)
								2.Cyber Crime Investigation, Supreme Prosecutors' Office (cyberid@spo.go.kr/ 02-3480-3571)
								3.Cyber Terror Response Center, National Police Agency (www.ctrc.go.kr/ 182)
							
						
					


					Article 10. 3rd party's sites and services
					The website, product or service of the Company may include the links to the ones of a 3rd party and the privacy protection policy of the site of 3rd party may be different. Thus, it is required for the users to check additionally that policy of a 3rd party site linked to the site of the Company.

					Article 11. Others
					The Company may amend its Privacy Policy to reflect any legal or service changes. The Company shall notify such amendment 7 days earlier in advance
						

					
					
						Notification Date: March 05, 2020
						Enforcement Date : March 12, 2020
